general.headline: Former Software Engineering Intern at WSO2
general.description:
I’m a passionate IT undergraduate looking for a career in software engineering. I’m more into web-based applications, and also interested in building mobile apps as well. I was able to maintain an outstanding academic record in balance with extra-curricular activities, where I was able to actively participate in several clubs, societies. 
 I was able to get great experience and corporate exposure through the global internship program of AIESEC. And was also able to provide community service through the Rotaract club.
 Sports has always been my thing, where I was able to secure a spot in the interschool aquatic club as a distinguished swimmer representing my alma mater. I also played basketball at the university level.
Apart from the work, I would like to spend my spare time by listening to music, playing guitar, traveling, visiting untouched beauty spots around the country. Outdoor adventures like rock climbing, hiking and rafting have always been my all-time favorites.

Real Estate Management System
Nov 2016 – Mar 2017

Project descriptionReal Estate Management System is comprehensive online service that interconnects and provides a platform for all the stakeholders of Real Estate Industry to easily and effectively perform they duties and fulfill requirements. For placing and advertising available property of a property owning company, creating, administering e-Contracts for rents and lease to even managing specific repairs/job cards of tenants, REMS provides "the" most comprehensive solution managing your real estate. The project was completed as the 2nd year Industry Project for We Are Designers International (Pvt) Ltd.

Nisal Waduge Aeshana shalindra Udadeniya Shakthi Weerasinghe
See project Real Estate Management SystemSee project
Project nameExpressway Life Saver (ELS)
Jan 2015 – Nov 2015

Project description With the increasing population, usage of expressways has been a popular mode of transportation around the world. Although highways cater the speed of life, it compromises the safety of its users which in fact requires more safety measures while traveling in them. Even though, highway statistics provide the fact that the rate at which accidents occur are seemingly low, the impact or the fatality of accidents were very high. Therefore, an autonomous system that would cater all the above problems was in need.
The Expressway Life Saver caters this issue by providing efficient accident prevention strategies and post-accident recovery plans. It intends to make the highway systems safer for all the user groups from drivers to passengers by a technological solution. The device is portable and thus convenient to use while traveling. Unlike in other safety systems, it prevents accidents with its speed alerts and keeps the driver in focus with its interactive interface. It alerts the authorities in situations of reckless driving or in an occurrence of a fire or a crash. Also, it backs up highway user data into a database which could be used to the effective handling of the highway system. The system comes as a package of all these features embedded with cutting-edge technology, making it competitive in the marketplace in contrast to its alternatives.
The device consists of typical fire sensor and utilizes GSM, GPRS and GPS technologies in order to pass messages and to generate speed, the location of the vehicles. Several test runs were carried out and the outcomes were quite accurate. It responded positively in low signal coverage and resisted quick flames. In overall it was quite a success and could be further developed with the introduction of sophisticated technology.
Other creators

general.headline: Undergraduate - University of Moratuwa
general.description: An undergraduate aspiring to become a professional within the IT industry. For me, learning never stops and my desire to learn mainly resides in the areas of Big Data Analytics, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. In addition, my interests include current affairs and world politics.

projects.description:
A Performance Evaluation for automatically generated Data Mining algorithms in different Machine Learning Libraries
Project descriptionThis is my final year research project that is currently in progress. This project enables any user, either a novice or expert, to specify a problem related to data mining and write a simple pseudo code using natural language. The natural language specifications are then converted to a universal intermediate model written in XML. The intermediate model is then converted to the actual implementation of the machine learning codes in SKLearn (Python) and R. The results from the different library implementations are compared and an evaluation and interpretation of the results are provided to the user, similar to an expert system. This project was undertaken to allow even novice users to perform analytics and also to evaluate the different libraries/languages with regard to their performance, since most data analysts are familiar with a single library/language. 
My part of the project is the conversion of the XML model to the actual code. Although conversion of pseudo code to source code is not a new idea, most of the research involves using rule-based approaches. This can be exhaustive as it demands the implementation of a large number of rules and extensive specification of regular expressions. My research involves using a more efficient and automated technique to perform the translations, inspired by techniques of Natural Language Machine Translation(MT) such as Statistical Machine Translation and even Neural Machine Translation. The research is ongoing however, my part of the project most probably needs a hybrid rule-based and MT approach.
Other creators
Dinusha Harankahawa Madusha Gunasekera
Project nameA Restaurant Recommendation Engine
Project descriptionThis project was implemented using a data set collected by the Indian Restaurant Search platform Zomato. The project aimed to recommend to users restaurants based on his/her preference of price range and cuisine type. The restaurants closest to the users price and cuisine preference were identified and recommended to the user after performing the necessary filtering. Techniques of Clustering, classification and Item-to-Item Collaborative Filtering were used to implement this engine.
Other creators
Madusha Gunasekera Dinusha Harankahawa Milan Karunarathne
Project nameGamers' Shop Game Store
Project descriptionThis was the project that our team undertook for the second year academic project. As the name suggests the project is a web based application that allows users to upload and download games. Games are categorized based on categories defined in the store. There are mainly two users, the developers and the players. Many of the features available on the store would require the users to sign up and log in. Games can be downloaded freely or purchased via Pay Pal. Depending on the user's experience, he/she can rate and review games. Games are rated using a star rating system with a scale from 1 to 5. Reviews are basically comments about the user's experience about the game.
Other creators
Amjed Anver. Madusha Gunasekera Dinusha Harankahawa
Project nameMuseum Guide Robot
Project descriptionThis was a project that was inspired by the lack of technological infrastructure in the museums of Sri Lanka. Instead of separate multimedia systems installed for different galleries/artifacts, a robot was developed, that guides museum visitors along a designated path and provides information about key artifacts in the museum via video. The robot is programmed to stop near the artifacts, identify the location and play a video file relevant to that artifact. This project has the potential to save the huge costs that museums spend on installing multimedia systems since all of these tasks are achieved with one system and is especially ideal to be applied in Sri Lankan museums, where tourists' interest for historical information is a priority on their itineraries.

allSkills: Python (Programming Language), Java, SQL, Machine Learning, Data Mining, C#, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js, Visual Studio, .NET Framework, Public Speaking, Compering, Debating, Artificial Neural Networks, Pycharm, MVC, SPARQL

projects.description:
Responder
Feb 2018 – Present

Project descriptionA GitHub Integration built with Probot that sets expectation for response for new contributors. In open source projects any new contributor can create pull requests or issues. When contributors do one of the following things they always seek for the feedback from the existing contributors (maintainers). As the contributors are unaware when the maintainers will respond them, they have to check the activity of the repository time to time. When contributors are acknowledged properly, it is easy to keep their interest on particular project. The Responder is to acknowledge the contributors in a timely manner and to get the attraction of the maintainers towards the contributors in an efficient manner. This will predict the response time by calculating the average of the initial responses given by the maintainers to previous issues and pull requests. Then a bot can acknowledge the contributors when they can receive a response. Also adding a label to indicate the remaining time will grab the attention of the maintainers and help them in responding to contributors. Other than that maintainers can define categories to issues/pull requests beforehand so that contributors can use them and categorize their issues/pull requests.

See project ResponderSee project

Project nameFileX
Apr 2016 – Apr 2017

Project descriptionWith the immense development of the technology most of the organizations in the business world tend to use technological aspects to make their operations more convenient. Software industry which steps forward with the innovative technologies always ensure that it is up to date with the latest technology that can be applicable on its operations. Development of a software project passes through various stages of the Software development life cycle. Starting from the requirement gathering stage a specific set of documents has to be created, approved and maintained throughout the process of development. Before commencing the development of a system it should be approved by a set of responsible roles in the company. Software Requirement Specification (SRS) document which states the required functionality of the system is one of the major documents that is to be approved. Most of the companies use a paper based method for the approval process which is handled manually by responsible individuals. However this manual file based system is said to be consists of several drawbacks such as time wastage, less efficiency and resource wastage. In addition the progress of the approval process cannot be monitored through a paper based mechanism. In an effort to overcome these problems ‘FileX’ document approval system introduces a web based application and an iOS mobile application to make the document approval process more efficient. The system facilitates to create projects, assign responsible roles, upload documents, approve SRS document and monitor the progress of approval. The system was evaluated using user centric methods and results indicated that it reduces the time consumed on approval process and reduces the resource wastage making the overall process more effective and convenient. With this respect FileX gives an impressive experience to the user rather than the conventional method.

Technologies: JSP, Servlets, Oracle Database, JavaScript, HTML, CSS & Bootstrap framework

Other creators
Praveen Thrilanka Gamage Erandi Atapattu Nishani Abeysinghe Reshani Mihirika
See project FileXSee project
Project nameWeb App - Are You Ready 2016
Oct 2016 – Dec 2016

Project descriptionThe Official Careers Fair of the University of Moratuwa, 'Are You Ready? 2016', which was held for the 21st consecutive time concluded recently. This event that claims a prominent place in the university calendar, was organized by the Career Guidance Unit in collaboration with the Rotaract Club of the University of Moratuwa and was attended by over 1100+ undergraduates and 60+ companies with 80+ interview panels.

The prime objective of 'Are You Ready?' is to bridge the gap between the soon-to-be graduates and the corporate sector. While preparing undergraduates for recruitment in the industry, it also gives an opportunity for the corporate sector to avail themselves of the talent that the University of Moratuwa has to offer.

The event was tailored to encompass all areas critical for the success of an undergraduate through its five sessions; The Resume, The Careers Forum, YOU TM, The Exemplar and The Dining Etiquette and Grooming Workshop. The highlight of the event was the Flagship Day held where an approximate 1100+ final year undergraduates were interviewed by companies for recruitment.

Technologies: JSP, Servlets, MySQL, JavaScript, Maven, HTML, CSS & Bootstrap framework.

Project descriptionWater Pollution affects humans as a whole as water is a basic need for human sustenance. Just as every other hazard to human life may it governments or people individually do not stay focus to detect pollution beforehand. Only after a death or a tragic occurrence, people pay attention. Therefore it is crucial to detect pollution at early stages before human/ animal lives, businesses
are affected. Water quality is basically measured by the WQI ( Water quality Index) which is the most important quality standard to identify.

Project nameChemistryTutor
Mar 2017 – Mar 2018

Project descriptionDialog Gaming Partnership with Team CODEX

In Sri Lanka at present there is less no of attractive learning aids to support the OL and AL students in learning subjects like chemistry. The subjects like chemistry has become so boring as there are lot of formulae to remember. On behalf of using traditional books, this is an attempt to create an interactive graphical learning application which can help to memorize chemical formulae. 
This is basically an android game with user friendly interfaces which can help students to memorize chemical formulae, colors of the elements and compounds. This is a time-based game with daily challenges with mcq type questions where graphics and animations are used to give a clear understanding on context of the question. 

Dialog Gaming has become a Partner with our team CODEX on developing edutainment based games.
This is basically 2 months project .The revenue will be shared according to the agreement with two parties.

Project nameGarage and Service Station Reservation System
Jul 2016 – Feb 2017

Project descriptionThis was the second year industry based project. Cooperated by four members. I acted a the team leader.
This software slotion for a Garage and Service reservation system which resolve lot of problems in reserving garage and service stations. Main issue that is observed here is that lot of queues near garage and vehicle reservation stations that waste human valuable time. Through this system a Garage or service owner can display their services while a vehicle owner can buy or make reservation for a service. Fist a service or garage owner need to log in to the system and display their services in the system. Then a vehicle owner can add their vehicle in to the system and request for those services. As additional feature a Garage and Service station management system and online buying system is included here. There is no existing system in Sri Lanka. Therefore this project can be considered as an innovative system for Sri Lanka. This is basically a web and android project. Spring with JDBC is used as the web frameworks. Technologies such as JavaScript, JQuery, and AJAX are used to make the client side more interactive. Google Maps and Street view API are used as additional feature in this system. Through this system the problem in reserving garages and service stations are solved to great extent. 
Technologies Used : Java 8, Spring MVC, JDBC Template, Google Maps, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX, MySQL, Boostrap
Other creators

PIR sensor was used to detect the location of a human being. After the detection the fan automatically rotates to the direction of that human.
Humidity sensor and temperature sensor will sense the environmental conditions and helps the fan to adapt to different conditions.

Project nameAdora.lk
May 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionAdora.lk is an online marketplace which aims at providing customized apparels along with a
user-friendly graphical interface to design bespoke apparels.
This grants customers the privilege of printing t-shirts according to their necessity, by uploading
the desired pattern or the design they wish to print. Furthermore, they are allowed to customize
their apparels conforming to their requirement by uploading any design they prefer. When a
customer visits the website to purchase a product, his/her measurements will be taken in order to
decide an appropriate size from the available sizes(S, M, L). Subsequently, the customer can fit
on their clothes from the smart devices available at department stores. This process follows the
concept of “a virtual fit on room”.
Customers are granted the benefit of visualizing clothes on a VR model using a VR glass.
Adora.lk has the feature of giving suggestions to its users. These suggestions are filtered in
accordance with the user attributes. Basically this assists customers by recommending the most
suitable outfits. The recommendations are done according to,
· Previous searches from social media, and site itself
· Customer attributes(Complexion, Body shape).
Customers are encouraged to collaborate with the designers in order to make their dream design
breathe to life.
The purchased apparels will be delivered at your doorstep.
Smart Payments

See project Adora.lkSee project
Project nameSapphires.lk
Jun 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionSapphires.lk is a web app which aims at providing a sustainable solutions to buyers and sellers of gems/sapphires of the lucrative gem market of Sri Lanka. The traditional method which prevails currently is where the gem-miners (mine owners) presenting the rough stones to the nearest gem dealer where it’s cut and polished, and sold to another party at much higher price. Such sold gems are passed through several intermediate buyers before reaching the final buyer. The idea of this website/web app is to extract the lump sum of profit stacked in the hands of these intermediaries by connecting the final buyer and the gem miner. Basically, the web app would provide the facility to create profiles to both buyers (foreign/local) and sellers and would the sellers could add their gems to the site through their profiles. Only the cut and polished stones would be published and Sapphire.lk would provide several free cutting and polishing services too if required.
A most distinguishing feature of this web app is that caters several pains of the users in a realistic way with the use of sophisticated technology. The website uses Augmented Reality/ Virtual Reality technologies to provide a realistic 3D image of the gemstone to a remote buyer so that he/she could check for the cracks, intrusions of the gem as if it is at his fingertips.

Other creators
Shakthi Weerasinghe Praveen Thrilanka Gamage Nisal Waduge Randilu Soysa
See project Sapphires.lkSee project
Project namePanelclaw - ClawOS
Aug 2017 – Feb 2018

Project descriptionClawOS is a web based application along with a SaaS platform designed and developed for PanelClaw USA a solar mounting systems manufacturer and lay out designer company located in North Andover MA [https://www.panelclaw.com/]
ClawOS front end is implemented using ReactJS, OpenLayers and Google Maps API on top of NodeJS back-end running in AWS lamda. The front-end interacts with a .NET based SaaS application running on top of AWS EC2 auto scaling infrastructure which implements a scalable MATLAB logic executor and a scheduler with a high performance reports generator. This application is engineered to automate and optimize the solar panel layout and designing process of PanelClaw to bring the lead time of a project to a minimal level.

See project Panelclaw - ClawOSSee project

general.headline: Final Year Undergraduate University of Moratuwa
general.description:
I'm a Self Motivated, Hard working and Dedicated student who always trying to achieve the perfection and never settle at a lower level. Keeping the statement of John F. Kennedy's at the peak of the race to space : 
"We chose to go to the moon in this decade and do the other things, NOT because it's easy, just because it's hard" 
as the motivation for life,I believe myself to be capable of achieving great things through hard and smart work using leadership, knowledge and personal skills. 
Hence, I'm a multi tasking individual contributing to youth activities, volunteering and sports while perfecting in the field of academics.The passion to take leadership, the strive to win, seeking new knowledge, never giving up and full commitment have been my key strengths and which I believe would have taken myself this far.
Passionate about Space, Aerospace Technologies and Aeronautics, while being curious on Artificial intelligence and IT, as ambitious to find myself to be a pioneer where these fields would intersect in the future.

jobs.jobTitle: Editor In Chief for FIT Chronicle
jobs.description:
Having got promoted to Editor-In-Chief of the official publication of the faculty, imparted great responsibility and a challenge. Being one of the trio behind the 'change' of the magazine from 2015, the responsibility in simple words was to carry forward the good work and improve the magazine continously in what ever the way possible. Having tabled a vision for the magazine at it's revamp - 'Continuously improve in quality and content', 2017 edition of the magazine reached that vision far beyond the expectation, having gathered many volunteers with quality content and doubling the content from last year. This was quite a mile stone for the magazine as many features, which were not able to include in the previous were included and provided excessive space to portrait the immense talent of the students in the faculty in all aspects. 
Although, it was great pleasure working with the biggest crew yet for the magazine and it would have not been possible without this team effort.

The main responsibilities were to manage the articles and in fact to make sure that the
      magazine would give the best reader's experience. Hence, the December 2015 issue of
      FIT Chronicles was a whole new version after revamping it in design, content and
      
      brand. Since then, the magazine would have a further issue for 2016.

I had the privilege of working alongside the best industry experts at the "Greatest place to work" in Sri Lanka as trainee software engineer in which a wealth of knowledge and experience was gained. Having worked on a research project and especially in a comprehensive client project : Boligmappa, I had the opportunity of working on a very wide scope of technologies including, Apache Spark, Scala, C#, .NET, Angular 1 and 2, AWS - Dynamo DB, Lambdas, EC2, S3, Serverless, Typescript, WordPress PHP, Node JS, Jenkins, NUnit, Web Services, REST APIs using Steroids Framework, MSSQL and several key integrations such as MailUp and 24Seven Office.  
Apart from the core functionalities, I was able to work in several initiatives including Dotitude - which included organizing several quizzes, 'Dotitude Live' webinars ,Uni Relations - conducting a session on 'CV writing and Online presence' at University of Moratuwa and Badminton, while providing considerable amount of support with Graphic Design for almost all the other initiatives.  
I also had the opportunity in taking part in the 6 day workshop with CEO of Boligmappa in which several key concerns in Boligmappa were discussed.

Global Entrepreneurship Program of AIESEC is a new initiative by the organization where it aims at encouraging and shaping the youth to step out of their comfort zone by taking up Entrepreneurship that will potentially help a local economy or even the world. Therefore, the voluntary internship program to work at a locally reputed Start Up Company, the GE program was initiated for the first time in Sri Lanka at AIESEC Colombo South and I am currently managing the operations of this new venture.

Project nameAdora.lk
Jul 2017 – Present

See project Adora.lkSee project
Project nameSapphires.lk
Jun 2017 – Oct 2017

Project descriptionSapphires.lk is a web app which aims at providing a sustainable solutions to buyers and sellers of gems/sapphires of the lucrative gem market of Sri Lanka. The traditional method which prevails currently is where the gem-miners (mine owners) presenting the rough stones to the nearest gem dealer where it’s cut and polished, and sold to another party at much higher price. Such sold gems are passed through several intermediate buyers before reaching the final buyer. The idea of this website/web app is to extract the lump sum of profit stacked in the hands of these intermediaries by connecting the final buyer and the gem miner. Basically, the web app would provide the facility to create profiles to both buyers (foreign/local) and sellers and would the sellers could add their gems to the site through their profiles. Only the cut and polished stones would be published and Sapphire.lk would provide several free cutting and polishing services too if required.
A most distinguishing feature of this web app is that caters several pains of the users in a realistic way with the use of sophisticated technology. The website uses Augmented Reality/ Virtual Reality technologies to provide a realistic 3D image of the gemstone to a remote buyer so that he/she could check for the cracks, intrusions of the gem as if it is at his fingertips.

Other creators
Nisal Waduge Aeshana shalindra Udadeniya Randilu Soysa Praveen Thrilanka Gamage

Project nameiCare
Dec 2016

Project descriptioniCare - a wearable health monitoring, detection and remote response system. The system with the wearable unit is more over a smart watch which detects different health conditions by evaluating 3 parameters using sensors. The concept was to create a potentially large network of these device against a distributed server system of independent servers corresponding to each hospital or health care service provider so that any patient, especially the elderly are monitored and taken care of 24x7 with the facility of recording any adnormalitiesa and history of illnesses as monitored by the watch. The device is supported by an android application as well.
The product was later modified to a particular version which was specifically targeted at Diabetic patients. The wearable was able to calculate the glucose level in blood and maintain a database that would allow the machine learning backed to classify (using SVC) and predict future conditions (using kNN and SVR) of diabetic condition in order to provide life long health support in maintaining good health condition not affected by diabetics. 
Therefore iCare is a complete package based on the concept of "Internet of Things" (IoT).
Other creators
Kasun Chinthaka Piyarathna Rakshitha Muranga Rodrigo Dinusha Harankahawa Tharindu Jayathilake

jobs.jobTitle: LEAD CS 4.0 - Oraganizing Commitee Vice President (Delegates)
jobs.description: Lead CS is the annual leadership development conference of AIESEC in University of Moratuwa. What is remarkable about Lead CS is that it is the only conference organized at the national level by an AIESEC Local Committee. First organized in 2014, Lead CS 1.0 – 3.0 was held at the Sanctuary House Negombo. The conference spans throughout 3 days and the delegates are provided with food and accommodation on all 3 days. Conference consists of various sessions, activities and events; few of which are Outbound Training, LEAD sessions, Gala Night, Award Ceremony and Parties. Redefining the standards set by stereotypical leadership development seminars and workshops, Lead CS has been able to provide life changing experiences to the delegates. The conference is often referred to as the turning point of AIESEC career of present and past AIESECers at University of Moratuwa.
